summary: This is an email chain from June 30, 2020, between FBI agents discussing and requesting approval for travel to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, believed to be in Massachusetts. The chain includes updates on tracking the target's phone to New Hampshire and a request to be notified immediately upon arrest.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email in the chain, providing an update that GPS pings indicate the target's phone is in New Hampshire, necessitating a change in plans.

persons.name: SSA- Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
persons.context: The recipient who requests to be notified as soon as an arrest is made or any other significant activity occurs, as they need to submit a Significant Case Notification (SCN).

connections.person2: SSA- Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
connections.description: Professional correspondence regarding operational planning and updates for an arrest in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel Approval Request for Arrest Operation
events.description: An FBI agent requests approval for travel to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, believed to be in Massachusetts. The plan involves four agents traveling by air, possibly escorting the target back to New York.
personsInvolved: SSA- Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS

events.title: Target Phone Location Update
events.description: Historical data from the target's phone indicates it is in New Hampshire, prompting a shift in operational plans away from the initial belief of Massachusetts.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning an arrest operation for a target in the Epstein investigation in late June 2020.
The target's location was initially believed to be in Massachusetts but was later indicated by phone data to be in New Hampshire.
The operation involved four agents traveling by air, with plans to possibly escort the arrested target back to New York.
A Significant Case Notification (SCN) was to be submitted immediately upon the arrest occurring.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing investigative activity related to the Epstein case years after his death.
